brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators hypothesize that the chronic kidney disease patients who suffer from
      vitamin D deficiency will be benefit from given Vitamin D2 because coronary artery
      calcification and hyperparathyroidism will be improved.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Vitamin D Supplementation on Coronary Calcification and Parathyroid Hormone in CKD Patients

detailed_description.textblock:
We will call for 350 CKD patients (250 CKD3-5stage and 100 CKD5D stage)who suffer from
      vitamin D deficiency.They will be divided into 2 groups. One group will be given vitamin D
      and the other will not. They will take coronary artery CT test every year(in 2 years).We
      will compare the coronary calcification progression between  the 2 groups.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  chronic kidney disease patients (3-5D)

          -  serum 25（OH）D < 40nmol/L(16ng/ml)，serum calcium < 2.55mmol/L（10.2mg/dL）；

          -  willing to sign

          -  could obey the follow up design

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  allergy to vitamin D

          -  heart failure (NYHA more than 2 grade)

          -  pregnant

          -  malignant tumor

          -  critical hepatic disease

          -  taking Vitamin D or analogue in 3 recent months

          -  taking other clinical trial

intervention.description:
25（OH）D level <12 nmol/L                50000IU/weekX12week， 12-39 nmol/L                50000IU/weekX4week then，50000IU/month， 40-75 nmol/L                50000IU/month， 75-116.75nmol/L          25000IU/month，
＞116.75nmol/L          stopped.

keyword: The calcification score of coronary artery

facility.name: The People's Hospital of Peking University

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Vitamin D Supplementation on Coronary Calcification and Parathyroid Hormone in CKD Patients

primary_outcome.description: We use CT to detect the coronary artery calcification score in the chronic kidney disease patients for 3 times (baseline, 12 month and 24 month). We will compare the 2 arms （treatment or not）to know if there is any difference。
primary_outcome.measure: the improvement of coronary artery calcification

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: We detect the microalbuminuria in the chronic kidney disease patients for 5 times (baseline, 6 month,12 month 18month and 24 month). We will compare the 2 arms （treatment or not）to know if there is any difference。

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
